teacheasy.mediahandler.answerbox

Class AnswerBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • teacheasy.mediahandler.answerbox.AnswerBox

  • public class AnswerBox
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to draw answer boxes with the specified x & y locations and character limit. The class also checks entered answer against list of possible answers and assigns them the predefined marks.
    Version:
    1.1 07 Mar 2015
    Author:
    Daniel Berhe, Jake Ransom

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AnswerBox.ButtonEventHandler
      Button event handler class
      class  AnswerBox.KeyEventHandler
      Key press event handler
      class  AnswerBox.MaxLengthListener
      This class limits the number of characters that can be typed in the textField to the the specified nCharacterLimit

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnswerBox

        public AnswerBox(double nXStart,
         double nYStart,
         int nCharacterLimit,
         boolean nRetry,
         int nMarks,
         boolean nIsNumerical,
         javafx.scene.Group nGroup,
         float nUpperBound,
         float nLowerBound,
         java.util.ArrayList<Answer> nAnswers)
        A constructor to create answer box object
        Parameters:
        nXStart - The x coordinate of the object
        nYStart - The y coordinate of the object
        nCharacterLimit - Maximum allowed characters
        nRetry - To allow retry
        nMarks - Possible marks for a correct answer
        nIsNumerical - Whether or not numerical input is expected
        nGroup - The group this answer box will be added to
        nUpperBound - Upper range of numerical solution
        nLowerBound - Lower range of numerical solution
        nAnswers - Solutions to questions

    • Method Detail

      • checkAnswer

        public boolean checkAnswer(int nMarks)
        This method stores the potential answers in an array. When an answer is provided the loop compares the entered answer against the possible answers in the array. It also allows/disallows retry depending on the value of the variable retry.
        Parameters:
        nMarks - Awarded marks for a correct answer
        Returns:
        true for a correct answer

      • displayFeedback

        public void displayFeedback()
        A method to display feedback to the user

        public boolean isMarkCollated()
        Method for getting markCollated
        Returns:
        true if marks have been collated
